p.s: I'm happy that you contacted me.
How are you and your family?
recently you said that you can imagine to spend a year in Germany, specifically in Berlin after school.
I found an article by Marina Kormbaki Berlin spricht Englisch in the Hannoversche Allgemeine Zeitung from 2015.
The title says Berlin speaks englishEnglish and I wanted to tell you about it.
most people in Berlin speak englishEnglish now.
The reason is that many people from englishEnglish speaking countries travel there and many of them moved to Berlin.
In many parts of Berlin the most people don't speak German anymore but other languages and the most spoken one istis englishEnglish.
Also the most signs in restaurants and shops are in englishEnglish.
Furthermore many englishEnglish speaking people work there so you don't have to be afraid that you will not understand them.
Besides there is a little book shop named curious fox which sells second hand englishEnglish books.
So you can read in englishEnglish too.
Moreover it is pretty affordable to live in Berlin.
The costs are not that high like in other metropoles.
I hope that this article convinced you a little more to go to Berlin next year.
I would be happy to see you.
